intro: Dissochaeta annulata var. rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. This species is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils.
